title: Man Utd and Barcelona target Gelson extends Sporting contract, as Coates deal is completed
text:
Man Utd and Barcelona target Gelson extends Sporting contract, as Coates deal is completed AFP 0 Feb 2, 2017 22:54:07 The highly-rated winger has committed his long-term future to the Portuguese giants, who have also taken up an option on the ex-Sunderland defender 
Sporting CP have tied highly rated winger Gelson Martins to a new five-and-a-half-year contract and exercised their option to purchase Sebastian Coates from Sunderland. 
Gelson has reportedly attracted interest from Manchester United, Real Madrid and Barcelona in the last year after coming through Sporting's ranks, having made his Primeira Liga debut in August 2015. 
Gelson going nowhere, insists agent 
The 21-year-old's ability on the ball and pace have made him an eye-catching proposition, with Fernando Santos handing him a senior international debut in October. 
And he now looks set to either remain at Sporting for several more years or, should he move, bring in a sizeable fee, with the club revealing his new contract contains a €60 million release clause, €15m more than in his previous deal. É um orgulho vestir esta camisola e uma honra renovar com o clube do meu coração Seguimos juntos pic.twitter.com/SzNRHND01K — Gelson Martins (@GelsonMartins_) February 2, 2017 
Sporting also confirmed, in conjunction with Sunderland, they have opted to make Coates' loan move permanent - the Uruguayan also signing until July 2022 in a deal which sets his release clause at €45m. Related
